bugs.description: Function Linter.Lint starts a goroutine per package which, on any error from l.lintPackage, prints the error and calls os.Exit(1). Because this is executed inside a library routine and inside a child goroutine, the entire process terminates abruptly, bypassing the caller’s error-handling path and making the error return value of Lint useless. Library code should return the error to the caller instead of exiting the process.
